text:
I experienced so many St. Regist from around the world.
And Jakarta is not the best so far. 
Nor the worse either. 

But when ure getting use to, with the maintenance system and strive perfection of “St. Regist standard” you will know it, that this one still far from the standard itself. 

What’s nice from this experience, only the ‘buttler Mr. Yogi.
Team Housekeeping also Perfect. Very clean.
nice room, Nice bartender pool.

Breakfast is sad. 
Jacuzzi - under maintenance. Very Sad too. 
Gym and the personal trainer is Perfect.
Pool team is Wonderful.
Room service for Cocktails from the bar takes 2hours while i heard from my husband, the bar is ‘not full’  u name it. 

Had an evening cocktail in their nice lobby, i got bite my mosquito’s the whole evening. I asked to the lady server is there any mosquito’s inside this building, she said “yes thats normal” 😅

Looks like not fully ready to open the St. Regist Jakarta version. But at least from our experienced above, these should be lessons to learn as a trial and error. And look up to the “real St. Regist” standard system. :) 
 

I believe if you care to a small details, that will help you to reach your excellent review.
title: an honest experience.

text: My second Afternoon Tea at The Drawing Room, after my first wonderfull experience last month. Greeted warmly and directed by Ivanna to the Drawing Room. The oyster from the Luminairies package is fresh. The cake also got a good balance of sweet and savory bites. The praline and fruit pie are my favorites to end my afternoon tea. After we finished, butler named Klara gave us an amazing hotel tour, and really presenting us everything that make St. Regis is on another level than the other. Definitely will come again to stay here.

text:
I stayed at this newly open St. Regis in Jarkata back in mid-December 2022 and the property had only been open for two weeks. 

Of course it takes a bit of time with tremendous team effort to make sure everything is perfect, this property is no exception. That being said, as a guest, it’s always very exciting to stay at a newly open property. Not only do you get an all new facility in the very best condition possible, you can also get to see how the team there is making various adjustments to make sure it meets the brand’s consistency.

As soon as I arrived at the property, their team was very attentive and check-in was quick. Their team showed me around and walked me to my suite. I stayed at their Caroline Astor Suite, the gorgeous suite was meticulously designed and is absolutely beautiful.

On the first day, I ordered in-room dining since I was getting quite tired after the flight. To my surprise, it was very prompt and quick. In less than half an hour after I placed the order, my food was served in my room and the temperature was just right. 

I met up with quite a few good friends of mine and we mostly spent our time at their elegant Drawing Room and their signature St. Regis Bar. I’d suggest to first go to Drawing Room for a proper dinner and then make your way to the St. Regis Bar to enjoy some live jazz music with a bottle of champagne. 

They do their breakfast at their all-day dining restaurant - Bel Étage. Unfortunately by the time I woke up the next day, it was already too late so I did end up missing breakfast. Thankfully, I was able to try this restaurant for dinner on my last day and it was fabulous.

I would like to take a moment to thank Clement, Cindy, Chef Almatino, Ricky as well as the amazing St. Regis team for taking care of me during my stay and it was truly exquisite.
title: An Exquisite St. Regis Experience

text: Stayed at the hotel over the weekend for my birthday. Reception was elegant, lobby is beautiful, room is spacious, clean, bright, and smells really nice. Room service is excellent, the gym is well equipped. I enjoyed the breakfast at Bel’etage too. It was on the day of check out that I found out that my husband had arranged for a birthday cake and balloons to be delivered on my birthday, but was not executed. Request to meet the manager was denied and was met with the head butler instead, who said that they didn’t deliver because the room was on DND. That day I had ordered room service twice, had housekeeping come twice (for service & turn down), and I rang the butler once for tray clear up, so obviously my room was not on DND the whole day and night. Moreover, my husband was at the hotel the whole day & evening for a meeting and not once did they alert him that the room was not accessible. It was a lame excuse on their part. No apology was offered whatsoever when staff met me during checkout. What started as a lovely stay ended quite disappointingly. Will not come again for special occasions. The R hotel on satrio does special requests and celebrations MUCH better.

text:
Booked a deluxe room for an overnight stay, upgraded to next category room to Grand Deluxe as Bonvoy Elite benefit, not a suite room though it was available during my check in time. 
The room itself is pretty basic, low ceiling, with some wear and tear in certain area, with open balcony. No luxury feeling here, but rather homy, and this is sufficient for me. Yet I hope they can improve the room to give a better experience for the guests.
What set them apart was their service and the hospitality.  The butler, concierge, housekeeping, restaurant staff are all amazing. The super attentive Cik Tan (thank you!), Cindy, Novie, Robbie, F&B team were genuinely friendly and  helpful. I can't expect more, kudos to them. 
Breakfast spread are good with different choices available, but I suggest you to test their a la Carte menu. All the food were delicious (yes, I ate many!)
Hotel facilities are good : nicely designed swimming pool with some whirpool area, sufficient parking, fitness centre.
Overall it was a very pleasant experience. Thank you St. Regis!
title: Setting the Standard

text:
I usually don't review hotels as I travel often. Nothing in the hotel will surprise me. 
I stayed in hundreds of hotels last year, and nothing surprises me as I am getting used to the service. However, my experience in Jakarta is simply beyond my expected expectation. They make me feel that I do not need to say anything; everything happens automatically. The Butler, led by Chief Butler, Mr. Ersipit Pelawi, is the translation of what service is all about. I had a marathon meeting in Sarinah and St. Regis, and I had to manage my time in between. As usual in Jakarta, getting a taxi is a nightmare, but knowing the urgency of the meeting, Mr. Ersipit arranged a hotel car for me in just 5 minutes, and the anticipation he made was amazing. He asked the hotel car to wait for me in Sarinah and drove me back to the next meeting in St. Regis. On my departure day, I was in a rush, I asked my luggage to be packed immediately, and 4 Butlers came to my room and did the packing, which put me at ease. This is what a hotel should be, a service without being asked. This is amazing!! THANK YOU!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
title: AMAZING BUTLER

text:
I would say that this is the worst St Regis that I’ve ever stayed at. Even before my arrival, I already knew that my stay is not going to be a pleasant one. I regret the fact that I redeemed my suite night awards at this hotel, which in the end turns out to be a rather disappointing stay. 

Firstly, the room is comparable to Sheraton, with no automatic toilet installed and the ceiling is very low. The bar smells really bad as well as there is no separate area for non smokers, and the staff is not very attentive. One of the staffs was just hiding behind the wall, I think she was just too tired or something. 

Then the complimentary tea and coffee service wad a little bit weird. We can request for hot tea and a bucket of ice, but we can’t get an iced tea, which is kind of the same thing. 

The service was quite bad as well. They even forgot to make up my room and the order I made during breakfast took forever. I don’t think it’s a good St Regis with this level of service.

Lastly, I wouldn’t recommend this hotel at all at least until their service has improved. For now, it’s better to stay at Park Hyatt or Langham.
title: It’s better to stay at Park Hyatt or Langham instead

text:
I am going to repost this on TripAdvisor and on my website, glenntedja.com

The St. Regis Jakarta is an absolutely fantastic property located in a very prestigious area of Jakarta. While the physical hard product is definitely fantastic, I found that the experienced, exceptionally friendly, and proactive staff were the highlight of my 3 night stay during the opening week of the hotel. Let me elaborate on this topic first.

While the hotel itself is new, many of the staff here come from other prestigious hotels in the area (The Langham, Jakarta’s Club Floor being one of them) bringing their experience along with them. The hotel is also the new home to staff ailing from other world-class properties, such as The Ritz-Carlton Langkawi and The St. Regis Bali. These people know how to make their guests happy.

A common theme I found during my interactions with staff was genuine care for their guests. This translates to them being proactive and also exceptionally attentive towards all of us. Staff are always wandering the hotel, greeting guests by name and asking if they could help them with anything. They did this without being overly intrusive- just the right amount of presence. I apologize as I had so many exceptional interactions I only noted a few names down- I will do a better job of remembering people’s names next time.

Let me shout some out: 

Naufal, who worked at the pool area and provided attentive and friendly hospitality toward myself and my girlfriend
Cindy, the Loyalty Manager who checked-in with me throughout my stay, 
Ersipit, the Executive who was extremely friendly and provided the most incredible hospitality

And finally, the Breakfast service team: 

I have a test called “the Coffee test” which I apply to every breakfast experience I have at a hotel. It basically evaluates the attentiveness of staff towards their guests. The St. Regis Jakarta is the only hotel so far in Jakarta to have passed this test every single night, regardless of how busy the restaurant got. Essentially, it’s the amount of time before a staff approaches you to refill your coffee. If the time my coffee cup is empty is less than a couple minutes, then the hotel passes. The St. Regis Jakarta never let me have an empty coffee cup for more than a minute. I love my coffee in the morning so this is a huge deal for me 🙂

More on the breakfast: this is one of the best breakfasts not only in Jakarta, but in the world. The breakfast is an a la carte menu along with a massive, high-quality buffet from Chinese food to Indonesian food with 3 different kinds of fried rice and a pastry section 3 different kinds of marble cake. I’ll have a video up soon on my YouTube channel showcasing the buffet. It’s fantastic. 

As expected of being only a week old, the hotel is spotless in every way possible. The ambiance of the hotel is a very beautiful elegance you expect from The St. Regis brand. The lobby and rooms are designed by famous designers from Paris and New York, giving the hotel a modern but also classic feel. The hotel will soon have a spa, a couple high-end restaurants, a gift shop, and the prestigious St. Regis Bar open soon (the bar is already open). You won’t go hungry here. Additionally, the hotel has a couple more casual dining outlets including Rose Gourmand Deli which had an incredible selection of butchered meats, pralines, gelato, sandwiches, unique coffees, and teas. 

The pool area, designed by the famous maximalist Bill Bensley, was a place I spent a large amount of time in. It is incredibly relaxing to lounge in the water or in the huge circular sofas. I had the best time listening to a podcast while sipping on a coke while being cared for by Naufal here.

No complaints about the size of the room, either. The room is also one of the only in Jakarta with a balcony. 
Check out my room tour here: [4K] The BRAND NEW ST. REGIS JAKARTA'S Grand Deluxe Room

Finally, the location: while not particularly walking distance from anything, and something I thought was a weak point of the hotel, I honestly don’t think it's as bad. I am currently writing this from the Mandarin Oriental, a hotel located on the famous Bundaran HI where the Grand and Plaza Indonesia shopping malls are in. If you want to go to these malls, it takes about a 10-15 minute walk through a pretty unpleasant area with street vendors staring at you and the requirement to cross some high-traffic roads. If you want to take a car, it takes 10-20 minutes depending on traffic as you have to go around. It also takes, 10-20 minutes by car from The St. Regis. You see where I’m going? The St. Regis is also closer than the Bundaran HI hotels (MO, Kempinski, Grand Hyatt) to the other POIs in Jakarta. The only exception would be if you stayed at the GH or Kempinski- those are connected directly to the malls. However, the St. Regis is definitely still a good location.

I will most definitely be back at this exceptional property soon. I loved every second of my stay here and consider this to be one of the best hotel experiences I’ve had. 

Thank you to The St. Regis Jakarta team! See you soon!
title: One of the best hotel experiences, ever

text:
Finally I got a chance to stay at the highly anticipated Hotel in Jakarta. As one of their first guests to stay at the St. Regis Jakarta, it surely exceeded my expectations, I got smooth check in, kudos to their attentive staffs, Ms. Bella and Ms. Kiddy. 

Though my room was not upgraded to the Caroline Astor Suite, unlucky me! But they replaced it with their warm services and impeccable hospitalities. Not to mention, they arranged my welcome amenities very well. I was totally impressed. 

What I liked the most staying at the newly opened of the St. Regis Jakarta was they still maintain their signature tradition, namely Sabrage at 6 PM every Friday and Saturday. This made my experience unique compared to other 5 star hotels in Jakarta. In addition, I got a chance to have that evening ritual, Sabrage in my room, I loved it. Mr. Ersipit Pelawi, their Executive Butler and Mr. Aleph Harris, his assistant explained and taught me very well on how to use the St. Regis sabre properly. I got my free champagne celebration in my room. A pleasure, indeed. Thank you for the outstanding services. 

I have to give credit to their butler service, especially Mr. Elvan. He gave me an impeccable services. He explained the property very well too. Bravo the St. Regis Jakarta! 

Overall, I love to stay at the St. Regis Jakarta. It was eye-pleasing to see an extravagant Porte Cochere with that remarkable florex and the jaw-dropping Great Hall with lasvit chandelier and grand piano. The last but not the least, I loved to experience the lasvit performance, the light and the music synchronized beautifully. An Unforgettable stay at the St. Regis Jakarta for sure. I can hardly wait to be back! Kudos to all the St. Regis team for the opening of this lavish hotel in the golden triangle district of Jakarta.
title: An Unforgettable Stay at the St. Regis Jakarta!
